text:
Hi,

I have run http://errorprone.info tool into JMeter code and it detect some warning

I have 3 warnings in src\core\org\apache\jmeter\samplers\SampleResult.java file

    [javac] C:\Util\0_perso\JMeterSVN\jmeter\src\core\org\apache\jmeter\samplers\SampleResult.java:714: warning: [DefaultCharset] Implicit use of the platform default charset, which can result in e.g. non-ASCII characters being silently replaced with '?' in many environments
    [javac]             responseData = response.getBytes(); // N.B. default charset is used deliberately here
    [javac]                                             ^
    [javac]     (see http://errorprone.info/bugpattern/DefaultCharset)
    [javac]   Did you mean 'responseData = response.getBytes(UTF_8);' or 'responseData = response.getBytes(Charset.defaultCharset());'?


Antonio
creator: ra0077@gmail.com
